page.title: 06HOUSING II
page.content: {West Bridgford}is an area where there are a lot of houses. A hundred years ago, there was just a little village around St. Giles' Church. Then land was sold for building houses and long, straight, tree-lined roads were made with houses on each side. Gradually, more and more land on the edges of the village was built on. Near our school is one of the later estates called{Abbey Park.}All the roads are named after abbeys. Most of the houses are detached and they are on short curved roads. There is still new building being done on one side of West Bridgford where large detached houses are being built. This area is called Tordean Park after two Nottingham people who won the World Ice Dancing gold medals in 1984.
